ppdiag 0.0.0.9000
  • Get started
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • `ppdiag`, diagnostic tools for temporal Point Processes

Reference

All functions

compensator()

Compensators for MMHP, HP HPP, and MMPP models

diagpp()

Generate diagnostic tools for different models, including quantile-quantile plot, ks plot, raw residual and pearson residual.

drawHPIntensity()

Draw the intensity of Hawkes Process

drawHPPIntensity()

Draw Intensity of Homogeneous Poisson Process

drawUniMMHPIntensity()

Draw the intensity of the Markov-modulated Hawkes Process(MMHP)

fithp()

Determine the MLE of hawkes process numerically

fithpp()

Fit a homogeneous poisson process

hawkes_max_intensity()

max intensity of a hawkes process

hp()

Create a Hawkes Process(HP) model

hpp()

Create a homogeneous poisson process model

intensity()

Compute the intensity of social network model

intensityqqplot()

Draw the intensity and q-q plot

interpolate_mmhp_latent()

Interpolate latent process of MMHP

ksplot()

KS plot to visualize the empirical and theoretical cdf curve

mmhp()

Create a Markov-modulated Hawkes Process(MMHP) model

mmhp_event_state()

Estimate the latent state for events of an MMHP

mmpp()

Create a Markov-modulated Poisson Process(MMPP) model

negloglik()

Compute negative log likelihood for social network models

negloglik_hp()

Fit a hawkes process using negloglik and optim functions

pearsonresidual()

Compute Pearson residuals for social network models

plothpp_step()

Draw Homogeneous Poisson Process

qqexp()

Plot Quantile-quantile plot for rescaled-inter-event-times

rawresidual()

Compute raw residuals for social network models

simulatehp()

Simulate Hawkes process during active state

simulatehpp()

Simulate homogeneous poisson process events

simulatemmhp()

Simulate Markov Modulated Hawkes Process
